entities.description: The act of forcibly taking someone away against their will.
A type of sexual assault involving non-consensual sexual intercourse.
Sexual activity involving anal or oral copulation.
The act of sexually violating someone with an object.
Touching or handling someone in a sexual manner without their consent.
The act of taking property unlawfully from a person or place by force or threat of force.
An attack intended to cause serious bodily harm to another person.
An attack without the intention of causing serious bodily harm.
The act of frightening or threatening someone, usually to make them do something.
The act of intentionally setting fire to property.
The practice of obtaining something, especially money, through force or threats.
The act of breaking into a building, typically to steal.
The act of stealing from someone's pocket.
The act of stealing a purse from someone through sudden and forceful means.
The act of stealing goods from a store.
The act of stealing items from a building.
The act of stealing from a coin-operated machine.
The act of stealing items from a motor vehicle.
The act of stealing parts from a motor vehicle.
All other thefts not classified under specific categories.
The act of stealing a motor vehicle.
The act of making an unauthorized copy or imitation of something, especially money.
The act of fraudulently obtaining money or property by deceit or manipulation.
The act of using someone else's credit card without authorization.
The act of pretending to be someone else for deceitful purposes.
The act of wrongfully obtaining welfare benefits.
The act of using electronic communications to defraud someone.
The use of someone else's personal information without their permission, usually for financial gain.
The act of breaking into computers or computer networks.
The wrongful taking of money or property by someone entrusted to manage it.
Crimes related to dealing in stolen property.
The deliberate destruction or damage of property.
Crimes involving the illegal possession, sale, or use of drugs.
Crimes involving the possession or use of drug paraphernalia.
Sexual activity between family members who are not legally allowed to marry each other.
Sexual activity with someone who is below the age of consent.
Materials that depict or describe offensive sexual conduct.
The act of risking money or other assets on an event with an uncertain outcome.
The act of promoting or helping with gambling activities.
